speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: The 'Lock Voice' feature is one of the most important workflow improvements for voice cloning. It saves you a significant amount of time.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: Normally, every time you click 'Clone Voice', the engine has to re-analyze your source audio file from scratch. This is computationally expensive.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: When you click 'Lock Voice', the engine performs this analysis once and then stores the resulting vocal data in memory.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: For every subsequent generation with that voice, the engine uses this cached data, which is dramatically faster than re-analyzing the file.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: The button will change to 'Unlock Voice' when a voice is cached. You can click it again to clear the cached data and load a new reference file.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: This feature is essential when working in the Batch Studio, which we will cover next. Please load chapter eleven.
